Articles.Content:
Front: Landing stature [Note lowered tracks]

Side: Parked/Flight stature [Tracks raised, windows blanked]

The windows blank in flight to prevent passengers and pilot seeing outside the vessel when the Skip Drive is active. Not to blank out the windows could result in unpleasent effects.

Everything you draw looks cute and pudgy.

On the other hand, how exactly does it balance on takeoff and landing with tracks only on the rear half?

I must have subconciously based it on the Blue Midget.

Except in this case, Horizon class has only one set of two wheels forward, like a conventional aircraft. I just didn\'t draw it in.
